task_description:
# Glance/Widget View

Create a Garmin glance widget that displays current fasting status, elapsed time, and progress percentage without opening the full app. Users can see their fast progress directly from the watch face.

## Rationale
Glances are the ultimate convenience feature for wearables - faster than even unlocking a phone. This directly addresses the competitor pain point of needing to pull out a phone. A glance check takes under 1 second vs 5-10 seconds for a phone app.

## User Stories
- As a faster, I want to see my progress from my watch face so that I don't have to open any app
- As a busy user, I want a 1-second glance at my fasting status so that I can stay informed with minimal interruption

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Glance view shows: fasting status (active/inactive), elapsed time, progress %
- [ ] Glance updates at least every minute during active fast
- [ ] Tap on glance opens full app
- [ ] Glance displays 'Not Fasting' state when no active fast
- [ ] Visual design consistent with full app styling
- [ ] Works on devices that support glances

patterns.storage_access: Use Storage.getValue() with type casting and null checks (see FastingSession.mc lines 75-82)
patterns.drawing: Use dc.setColor(), dc.clear(), dc.drawText() with centered layout (see FastTrackView.mc lines 28-52)
patterns.time_calculation: Use Time.now().compare(startTime) for elapsed seconds, then divide for hours/minutes (see FastTrackView.mc lines 62-64)
